category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 24-2 (Chairman Election Procedure, etc.)
contents: Article 24-2 (Chairman Election Procedure, etc.) ① If a non-permanent executive, including the Chairman, wishes to register as a candidate, he/she must submit his/her intention to register as a candidate in writing to the Secretariat at least 90 days prior to the expiration of the Chairman's term of office. However, in the case of a re-election or by-election, it must be submitted within 10 days from the date the reason for the holding is confirmed., ② When the Chairman submits his intention to register as a candidate in writing pursuant to Paragraph 1, Article 25 shall be submitted from the time of submission until the election date. The vice-president pursuant to Article 1 (excluding those who have submitted their intention to register as candidates in writing) shall perform the duties on his/her behalf, but if all vice-presidents have submitted their intention to register as candidates in writing, the senior director among the directors who has not submitted their intention to register as candidates in writing. performs the duties on his/her behalf. ③ If any of the following applies, the Chairman shall return to his/her previous duties from the next day. 1. If the intention to register as a candidate under Paragraph 1 is withdrawn in writing to the Secretariat, 2. Registration of the candidate 3. If a candidate has not applied for registration by the deadline; 3. If he or she has resigned as a candidate after registering as a candidate; ④ Notwithstanding paragraph 2, the president may represent the Sports Association only in international relations affairs that fall under any of the following items. ., 1. Sports-related events, competitions, meetings, negotiations, etc. held overseas, 2. International events held domestically (including competitions and conferences) hosted by the International Olympic Committee, the Olympic Council of Asia, or the Association of National Olympic Committees or agreed upon with the relevant ministries. ⑤ Non-standing executives who have submitted their intention to register as a candidate in writing pursuant to paragraph 1 shall deliberate on matters related to the election of the president from the time of submission until the election date (however, in the case of withdrawal or resignation, it shall be until that date). They cannot participate in the resolution., ⑥ If standing executives and employees wish to register as candidates, they must resign from their positions at least 90 days before the expiration of the chairman's term. However, in the case of a re-election or by-election, the person must resign from the position within 10 days from the date the reason for the holding is confirmed., ⑦ A person applying for candidate registration must report to the competent election management committee entrusted with election management at the time of application for registration. A refundable deposit must be paid., ⑧ The method of electing the chairman and determining the elected person shall be in accordance with the following items. Revised 2022. 11. 11., 1. The election of the president shall be held by secret ballot, and the person who receives the majority of valid votes shall be determined as the elected president., 2. If the number of majority votes is equal, the older person shall be determined as the elected president. , 3. If there is only one candidate, no vote is held and the candidate is determined as the elected candidate on the election day. ⑨ In addition to those stipulated in these Articles of Incorporation, the qualifications for the presidential candidate, reasons for disqualification, conditions for return of deposit, and the size of the presidential election organization Matters necessary for the election of the chairman, such as composition, registration and election procedures, establishment of the election operation committee, unfair election intervention and subsequent disciplinary action, shall be determined separately.
